p: Naturally occurring carbohydrates with aromatic aglycones are a class of important compounds, such as antibiotics (e.g., vancomycin and chromomycin), and some plant-derived phenolic hydroxyl compounds are also glycosylated (e.g., arbutin, sennoside A, and glucoside). Kitajima et al. (2003b) isolated compounds ( Table 4 , 190–198) from A. lancea and analyzed its structure. Some known compounds ( 201–203) of aromatic glycosides were identified from A. lancea by Feng et al. (2018). A. lancea also contains acyl sugar derivatives ( Table 5 ).
